unnormalised: The annual Diwali Mela at Select Citywalk, Delhi, is all set to begin on 28/10/2024 and will continue till 03/11/2024. Organizers have been working tirelessly since 10/10/2024 to prepone the arrangements, considering the early Diwali this year.
normalised: The annual Diwali Mela at Select Citywalk, Delhi, is all set to begin on twenty eighth October two thousand and twenty four and will continue till third November two thousand and twenty four. Organizers have been working tirelessly since tenth October two thousand and twenty four to prepone the arrangements, considering the early Diwali this year.

unnormalised: The Mela promises a week-long extravaganza of lights, colours, and festive cheer. Attendees can expect vibrant stalls showcasing traditional Indian handicrafts, clothing, and delectable sweets. There will be special performances each day starting at 6:00 PM, featuring Bollywood dance troupes and folk music ensembles. The highlight will be the fireworks display scheduled for 01/11/2024 at 8:30 PM.
normalised: The Mela promises a week-long extravaganza of lights, colours, and festive cheer. Attendees can expect vibrant stalls showcasing traditional Indian handicrafts, clothing, and delectable sweets. There will be special performances each day starting at six zero zero P-M, featuring Bollywood dance troupes and folk music ensembles. The highlight will be the fireworks display scheduled for first November two thousand and twenty four at eight thirty P-M.

unnormalised: Last year, the event drew approximately 50,000 visitors, and organizers are anticipating an even larger turnout this year. Security measures have been ramped up, with additional CCTV cameras and security personnel deployed throughout the venue, particularly during peak hours between 7:00 PM and 10:00 PM. A special parking arrangement has been made at the nearby DLF Place Mall.

unnormalised: In related news, the timings for the Chhath Puja celebrations at the Yamuna ghats have been finalized. Sunrise prayers will commence at 5:45 AM on 07/11/2024, and devotees are requested to arrive by 4:00 AM to secure a spot. The Delhi Traffic Police have announced road closures around the ghats from 10:00 PM on 06/11/2024 until 10:00 AM on 07/11/2024.

unnormalised: Residents are advised to plan their commute accordingly and to take advantage of the Delhi Metro services, which will operate with extended hours on both occasions. Happy festivities!
